meanings.definition: To make white or whiter in color.
meanings.sent1: She whited the walls with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The laundry detergent whited the socks perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat whited itself by rolling in flour.
meanings.sent4: The snowstorm whited the entire town overnight.
meanings.sent5: The sun whited the sandy beach, creating a beautiful contrast.

meanings.sent1: The whited wedding dress sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: His whited beard gave him a distinguished look.
meanings.sent3: The whited cake was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: The whited clouds floated lazily in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The whited snow-covered landscape was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To become white or whiter in color.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the old paper whited and became fragile.
meanings.sent2: The flowers whited as they dried in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The fruit whited after being left out in the sun too long.
meanings.sent4: The fabric slowly whited with each wash.
meanings.sent5: The paint on the fence whited in the hot summer sun.
